answers.answer: When I went to get hiv tested a month ago I was bothered about catching it off oral my doctor said hiv is hard to transmit he said if he was to take a blood sample of a hiv positive person and stab him self by mistake the chance is 900 to 1 he would get it that's blood on blood .

HIV is unable to reproduce outside its living host (unlike many bacteria or fungi, which may do so under suitable conditions), except under laboratory conditions; therefore, it does not spread or maintain infectiousness outside its host.HIV is transmitted by;Unprotected penetrative anal and/or vaginal sexSharing works with other IV drug usersMother to child
Great. Thank you! I happened to get a cold a day after this and it only added to the paranoia.
Well stop worrying KEEP CALM . If you get any more hiv like symptoms tell ur self there not there caused by anxiety trust me been thereSleep well you didn't catch hiv
You're welcome and a cold is just that a cold.

question: I was recently at Biology lab and we were doing blood type testing. We were using lancets(like the ones in diabetes testing) to draw blood. Even though I was wearing gloves, during clean up I cut myself on one of the lancets, deep enough to draw blood. I know I am being paranoid, but is there a risk of contracting HIV if someone who was infected used the lancet. I know its remote, but it still worries me.  Thanks
title: HIV lancet transmission
